alert.note: Alert for West Cameron (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 6:11AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Cameron, south central Jefferson Davis and southeastern Calcasieu Parishes through 715 AM CDT... At 611 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Holmwood to near Cameron to near Johnsons Bayou. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Charles, Cameron, Grand Lake, Lacassine National Wildlife Refuge, Lake Charles Regional Airport, Sabine National Wildlife, Grand Chenier, Johnsons Bayou, Hacketts Corner, Heberts Marina, Hackberry, Holly Beach, Creole, Sweet Lake, Gibbstown, Holmwood, Carlyss, Bell City, Constance Beach and Rutherford Beach. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 30 and 36. Interstate 210 between mile markers 3 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
